body.p: In order to obtain a sample of undergraduate students in the United States, a simple random sample of 10 states is selected. From each of the selected states, 10 colleges or universities are chosen at random. Finally, from each of these 100 colleges or universities, a simple random sample of 20 undergraduate students is selected. Thus, the final sample consists of 2,000 undergraduates.
This is an example of which type of sampling strategy?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Remember that a simple random sample of undergraduates would have selected directly from the pool of undergraduates, without first selecting states or colleges.

Incorrect. Remember that stratified sampling of undergraduates would have initially viewed the nation’s undergrads as being separated into strata according to some feature. It wouldn’t have involved any initial selection of states or universities.

Correct. This is an example of multistage sampling, because first a sample of a few states was selected, and then in each of those states another sample of a few universities was selected, and finally in each of those universities a sample of a few students was selected.

Incorrect. A convenience sample of undergrads would have selected directly from undergrads (without first selecting states or colleges), and it would have been only from students conveniently nearby (so it would not have involved random selection from the whole nation).

body.p: Which of the following is an example of stratified sampling?

input.choice: A sample of 351 people called a radio show to express their opinions about the verdict in a murder trial.
In order to assess students' satisfaction with the food establishment on campus, the first 50 students who came out of the student center were interviewed.
A poll asked a random sample of 1,112 adults whether they believe that the use of marijuana for medical reasons should be legalized.

A health educator wanted to study the sleeping habits of the undergraduate students in her university. For her study, the researcher chose a simple random sample of size 150 from each of the classes (150 freshmen, 150 sophomores, 150 juniors, and 150 seniors) for a total of 600 sampled students.

The human resources department of a large bank wanted to assess the job satisfaction of the bank's workers. The department chose four of the bank's branches at random and used all of the workers in those four branches as the subjects for the study.

response.feedback: Incorrect. This scenario would be a simple voluntary sample. There is no indication that the population of listeners was viewed as divided into separate strata according to some feature.
Incorrect. This scenario would be a simple convenience sample. There is no indication that the population of students was viewed as divided into separate strata according to some feature.

Incorrect. This scenario would be a simple random sample. There is no indication that the population of adults was viewed as divided into separate strata according to some feature, and no attempt was made to intentionally select a few people from separate strata of adults.
Correct. The researcher viewed the students as being divided into four separate strata (freshmen, sophomores, juniors, and seniors), and a few students from each stratum were selected.

Incorrect. This scenario would be a cluster sample. In stratified sampling, the population is viewed as divided into separate strata according to some feature, and then a few people (not strata) are selected from each stratum (not from only some of the strata).

body.p: In order to get people’s opinions about a particular Supreme Court decision a reporter interviewed 30 people who have gathered outside the courthouse waiting for the announcement. The reporter makes sure to question people who have signs expressing a variety of positions on the issue.
This is an example of which type of sampling strategy?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Simple random sampling involves some formal method of selecting individuals from a population such that each individual has an equal chance of being selected. In this case the sample consists of people who happen to be at the right place at the right time for the person doing the sampling.

Incorrect. Stratified sampling first divides the general population according to characteristics (such as gender or age) that are distinct from the question being addressed and then randomly select individuals from each group. In this case the sample consists of people who happen to be at the right place at the right time for the person doing the sampling.

Incorrect. Multistage sampling works down from a very large group of people by stratifying them into various groups and then doing random sampling at the end. In this case the sample consists of people who happen to be at the right place at the right time for the person doing the sampling.
Correct. Convenience samples contain people who happen to be at the right place at the right time for the convenience of the person doing the sampling.

body.p: Which of the following is an example of stratified sampling?

input.choice: In order to assess public attitudes on good nutrition the the first 40 people to leave a large grocery store were interviewed.
A sample of 37 people who came to speak before the city council on the proposed water conservation plan were surveyed.
Proponents of a local ballot measure conduct a survey of the city by randomly selecting 100 potential voters from each of its 18 zip codes.

The human resources department of a large retail chain wanted to assess the job satisfaction of the retail workers. The department chose 25 of the company's stores at random, and used all of the workers in those 25 branches as the subjects for the study.
A poll asked a random sample of 1,327 adults whether they supported stronger gun control measures.

response.feedback: Incorrect. This scenario would be a simple convenience sample. There is no indication that the population as a whole was viewed as divided into separate strata according to some feature.
Incorrect. This scenario would be a simple voluntary sample. There is no indication that the population of listeners was viewed as divided into separate strata according to some feature.
Correct. The proponents viewed the voters as being divided into 18 separate strata, and a few voters from each stratum were selected.

Incorrect. This scenario would be a cluster sample. In stratified sampling, the population is viewed as divided into separate strata according to some feature, and then a few people (not strata) are selected from each stratum (not from only some of the strata).

Incorrect. This scenario would be a simple random sample. There is no indication that the population of adults was viewed as divided into separate strata according to some feature, and no attempt was made to intentionally select a few people from separate strata of adults.
